discussion.content: C & D : Currently only the opportunity’s owner or users above the owner in the role hierarchy can add, update, or remove opportunity team members https://ideas.salesforce.com/s/idea/a0B8W00000GdYe5UAF/add-opportunity-team-member-enable-for-all-users-with-edit-right

C and D are the two options required for a sales rep to add a rep to the opportunity team.

A. A permission with Edit access on the Account object: This permission is not required to add a rep to the opportunity team.

B. Transferred ownership of the Account to the sales rep: Transferring ownership of the Account to the sales rep would not give them the ability to update the opportunity or add themselves to the opportunity team.

C. A role above the Opportunity owner in the role hierarchy: This is necessary as users can only add members to an opportunity team if they are above the opportunity owner in the role hierarchy.

D. Transferred ownership of the Opportunity to the sales rep: This is not necessary as the sales rep can add themselves to the opportunity team without owning the opportunity record.

For me, this is a tricky one. Although fields are not within the list under the Components section (first tab), when we click "Fields" (second tab) in a lightning page, the first thing we see is a "Fields Component" label, displaying all fields + sections + blank space, etc.

Record Detail Answer D
The Record Detail component displays fields and sections from the page layout associated with the object. When users view the Lightning record page, they see different fields and sections based on their profile and page layout assignments.

You can’t add, remove, or move the fields and sections when you’re viewing the component in the Lightning App Builder. You can only make field and section changes on the page layout.

Selected Answer: D
There's no such thing as a Fields component?
Record Detail Component would allow individual fields to be hidden via Dynamic forms.

questions.question_text:
At Ursa Major Solar, there is a custom object called Galaxy. The sales director wants users to only see certain fields when the Binary Cluster checkbox field is marked.

What Lightning component will satisfy this requirement?

Cloud Kicks has organization-wide sharing defaults on the opportunity set to private. However, members of the finance team need to see closed won opportunities. The finance team members all have roles under the finance director, while the sales team members have roles under the sales manager.

Which two options should the administrator use to meet these criteria? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A & D are correct

The two options that the administrator should use to meet these criteria are:

A. Share with roles and subordinates of the finance director role.
D. Create a criteria-based sharing rule where the won field = true.

Option A will allow the finance team members, who have roles under the finance director, to see the closed won opportunities. By sharing the opportunities with roles and subordinates of the finance director role, the finance team members will have access to the opportunities they need to see.

Option D will allow the finance team members to see only the closed won opportunities. By creating a criteria-based sharing rule where the won field = true, the administrator can ensure that only the closed won opportunities are shared with the finance team members.

choices.C: Select all opportunities owned by the sales manager role.
choices.B: Make an owner-based sharing rule where the won field = true.
choices.A: Share with roles and subordinates of the finance director role.
choices.D: Create a criteria-based sharing rule where the won field = true.

An administrator is creating a custom Opportunity record page for Sales users for new logo opportunities. They need to control what fields display on the record when a sales user is viewing the opportunity.

Where should the administrator edit what fields display in the details of the record page?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The record Record Detail Component does not allow changing which field to display. The displayed fields are from the page layout. As they are creating custom Opportunity record page this would be assigned to sales users profile.

Selected Answer: D
Tricky one... Most answers I've seen say D. I would normally say B but you can't specify profile access on the page layout (just whether the field is there or not, and then you'd use FLS to control profile/permission access). 
The record detail component on a Lightning Record Page can specify component visibility for specific users, so I would go with that.

B. Page Layout is where the administrator can edit what fields display in the details of the Opportunity record page when a sales user is viewing it.

Page layouts determine the layout and organization of fields, related lists, and custom links on a record detail page, and can be customized for different profiles and record types. The administrator can customize the page layout for the Opportunity object to control which fields are visible to Sales users when viewing an Opportunity record.
